    • core/issue/providers/github
    • GitHubIssueProvider

    Class GitHubIssueProvider

    GitHub Issues provider. Maps the barf state machine to GitHub labels (barf:*).

    Prerequisites: The gh CLI must be authenticated (gh auth login).

    Locking: Uses a barf:locked label — not POSIX-atomic. Designed for single-agent use; concurrent agents on the same repo may race.

    Deletion: GitHub issues cannot be deleted via the API. deleteIssue returns err — transition to COMPLETED instead.

    Testing: Pass a spawnFn to inject a mock gh implementation in tests. This avoids real network calls without mock.module process-global patching.

    Hierarchy (View Summary)

    • IssueProvider
      • GitHubIssueProvider

    Derived

    autoSelect

    • autoSelect(
          mode: AutoSelectMode,
      ): ResultAsync<
          | {
              body: string;
              children: string[];
              id: string;
              parent: string;
              split_count: number;
              state: "NEW"
              | "PLANNED"
              | "IN_PROGRESS"
              | "STUCK"
              | "SPLIT"
              | "COMPLETED";
              title: string;
          }
          | null,
          Error,
      >

      Selects the highest-priority available (unlocked) issue for the given mode.

      Priority order per AutoSelectMode:

      • plan: NEW
      • build: IN_PROGRESS → PLANNED → NEW

      Parameters

      • mode: AutoSelectMode

        Determines which states are considered and their priority order.

      Returns ResultAsync<
          | {
              body: string;
              children: string[];
              id: string;
              parent: string;
              split_count: number;
              state: "NEW"
              | "PLANNED"
              | "IN_PROGRESS"
              | "STUCK"
              | "SPLIT"
              | "COMPLETED";
              title: string;
          }
          | null,
          Error,
      >

      ok(Issue) for the best candidate, ok(null) if no eligible unlocked issue exists, or err(Error) on I/O failure.

      Inherited from IssueProvider.autoSelect

      • Defined in src/core/issue/base.ts:173

    checkAcceptanceCriteria

    • checkAcceptanceCriteria(id: string): ResultAsync<boolean, Error>

      Checks whether all acceptance criteria checkboxes in the issue body are ticked. Delegates parsing to parseAcceptanceCriteria.

      Parameters

      • id: string

        Issue to inspect.

      Returns ResultAsync<boolean, Error>

      ok(true) if all criteria are checked (or the section is absent), ok(false) if any - [ ] item remains, or err(Error) if the issue cannot be fetched.

      Inherited from IssueProvider.checkAcceptanceCriteria

    transition

    • transition(
          id: string,
          to: "NEW" | "PLANNED" | "IN_PROGRESS" | "STUCK" | "SPLIT" | "COMPLETED",
      ): ResultAsync<
          {
              body: string;
              children: string[];
              id: string;
              parent: string;
              split_count: number;
              state: "NEW"
              | "PLANNED"
              | "IN_PROGRESS"
              | "STUCK"
              | "SPLIT"
              | "COMPLETED";
              title: string;
          },
          Error,
      >

      Validates and applies a state transition.

      Delegates validation to validateTransition; writes the new state via writeIssue. Call this instead of patching state directly to preserve invariants.

      Parameters

      • id: string

        Issue whose state will change.

      • to: "NEW" | "PLANNED" | "IN_PROGRESS" | "STUCK" | "SPLIT" | "COMPLETED"

        Target state; must be reachable from the current state per VALID_TRANSITIONS.

      Returns ResultAsync<
          {
              body: string;
              children: string[];
              id: string;
              parent: string;
              split_count: number;
              state: "NEW"
              | "PLANNED"
              | "IN_PROGRESS"
              | "STUCK"
              | "SPLIT"
              | "COMPLETED";
              title: string;
          },
          Error,
      >

      ok(Issue) with the updated issue, err(InvalidTransitionError) if the move is illegal, or err(Error) on I/O failure.

      Inherited from IssueProvider.transition

      • Defined in src/core/issue/base.ts:151

    createIssue

    • createIssue(
          input: { body?: string; parent?: string; title: string },
      ): ResultAsync<
          {
              body: string;
              children: string[];
              id: string;
              parent: string;
              split_count: number;
              state: "NEW"
              | "PLANNED"
              | "IN_PROGRESS"
              | "STUCK"
              | "SPLIT"
              | "COMPLETED";
              title: string;
          },
          Error,
      >

      Creates a new issue with state NEW.

      Parameters

      • input: { body?: string; parent?: string; title: string }

        title is required; body and parent are optional.

      Returns ResultAsync<
          {
              body: string;
              children: string[];
              id: string;
              parent: string;
              split_count: number;
              state: "NEW"
              | "PLANNED"
              | "IN_PROGRESS"
              | "STUCK"
              | "SPLIT"
              | "COMPLETED";
              title: string;
          },
          Error,
      >

      ok(Issue) with the persisted issue (including assigned id), err(Error) on I/O or API failure.

      Example

      const result = await provider.createIssue({ title: 'Fix login bug', body: '...' });
      if (result.isErr()) logger.error({ err: result.error }, 'create failed');

      Overrides IssueProvider.createIssue

      • Defined in src/core/issue/providers/github.ts:127

    deleteIssue

    • deleteIssue(_id: string): ResultAsync<void, Error>

      Permanently deletes an issue. GitHub provider always returns err — use transition(id, 'COMPLETED') there.

      Parameters

      • _id: string

      Returns ResultAsync<void, Error>

      ok(void) on success, err(Error) on I/O failure or if deletion is unsupported.

      Example

      const result = await provider.deleteIssue('001');
      if (result.isErr()) logger.warn({ err: result.error }, 'delete unsupported, transition instead');

      Overrides IssueProvider.deleteIssue

      • Defined in src/core/issue/providers/github.ts:201

    fetchIssue

    • fetchIssue(
          id: string,
      ): ResultAsync<
          {
              body: string;
              children: string[];
              id: string;
              parent: string;
              split_count: number;
              state: "NEW"
              | "PLANNED"
              | "IN_PROGRESS"
              | "STUCK"
              | "SPLIT"
              | "COMPLETED";
              title: string;
          },
          Error,
      >

      Retrieves a single issue by ID.

      Parameters

      • id: string

        Issue identifier (e.g. '001' for local, GitHub issue number for github).

      Returns ResultAsync<
          {
              body: string;
              children: string[];
              id: string;
              parent: string;
              split_count: number;
              state: "NEW"
              | "PLANNED"
              | "IN_PROGRESS"
              | "STUCK"
              | "SPLIT"
              | "COMPLETED";
              title: string;
          },
          Error,
      >

      ok(Issue) on success, err(Error) if the issue does not exist or cannot be read.

      Example

      const result = await provider.fetchIssue('001');
      if (result.isErr()) logger.error({ err: result.error }, 'fetch failed');

      Overrides IssueProvider.fetchIssue

      • Defined in src/core/issue/providers/github.ts:114

    isLocked

    • isLocked(id: string): ResultAsync<boolean, Error>

      Checks whether the issue is currently locked by any process.

      Parameters

      • id: string

        Issue to check.

      Returns ResultAsync<boolean, Error>

      ok(true) if locked, ok(false) if not, err(Error) on I/O or API failure.

      Example

      const result = await provider.isLocked('001');
      if (result.isOk() && result.value) logger.warn({ id: '001' }, 'issue is locked, skipping');

      Overrides IssueProvider.isLocked

      • Defined in src/core/issue/providers/github.ts:237

    listIssues

    • listIssues(
          filter?: {
              state?:
                  | "NEW"
                  | "PLANNED"
                  | "IN_PROGRESS"
                  | "STUCK"
                  | "SPLIT"
                  | "COMPLETED";
          },
      ): ResultAsync<
          {
              body: string;
              children: string[];
              id: string;
              parent: string;
              split_count: number;
              state: "NEW"
              | "PLANNED"
              | "IN_PROGRESS"
              | "STUCK"
              | "SPLIT"
              | "COMPLETED";
              title: string;
          }[],
          Error,
      >

      Lists all issues, optionally filtered by state.

      Parameters

      • Optionalfilter: { state?: "NEW" | "PLANNED" | "IN_PROGRESS" | "STUCK" | "SPLIT" | "COMPLETED" }

        If filter.state is set, only issues in that state are returned.

      Returns ResultAsync<
          {
              body: string;
              children: string[];
              id: string;
              parent: string;
              split_count: number;
              state: "NEW"
              | "PLANNED"
              | "IN_PROGRESS"
              | "STUCK"
              | "SPLIT"
              | "COMPLETED";
              title: string;
          }[],
          Error,
      >

      ok(Issue[]) on success, err(Error) on I/O or API failure.

      Example

      const result = await provider.listIssues({ state: 'NEW' });
      if (result.isOk()) result.value.forEach(i => logger.info({ id: i.id }, 'found'));

      Overrides IssueProvider.listIssues

      • Defined in src/core/issue/providers/github.ts:118

    lockIssue

    • lockIssue(
          id: string,
          _meta?: { mode?: "split" | "plan" | "build" },
      ): ResultAsync<void, Error>

      Acquires an exclusive lock on the issue.

      • LocalIssueProvider: O_CREAT | O_EXCL atomic file creation in .barf/<id>.lock
      • GitHubIssueProvider: adds the barf:locked label (meta ignored)

      Parameters

      • id: string

        Issue to lock.

      • Optional_meta: { mode?: "split" | "plan" | "build" }

      Returns ResultAsync<void, Error>

      ok(void) on success, err(Error) if the issue is already locked.

      Example

      const result = await provider.lockIssue('001', { mode: 'build' });
      if (result.isErr()) throw new Error('Already locked by another process');

      Overrides IssueProvider.lockIssue

      • Defined in src/core/issue/providers/github.ts:207

    unlockIssue

    • unlockIssue(id: string): ResultAsync<void, Error>

      Releases the lock acquired by lockIssue. Safe to call if not locked.

      Parameters

      • id: string

        Issue to unlock.

      Returns ResultAsync<void, Error>

      ok(void) always — implementations must not return err for a no-op unlock.

      Example

      await provider.unlockIssue('001'); // safe even if not currently locked

      Overrides IssueProvider.unlockIssue

      • Defined in src/core/issue/providers/github.ts:223

    writeIssue

    • writeIssue(
          id: string,
          fields: Partial<Omit<Issue, "id">>,
      ): ResultAsync<
          {
              body: string;
              children: string[];
              id: string;
              parent: string;
              split_count: number;
              state: "NEW"
              | "PLANNED"
              | "IN_PROGRESS"
              | "STUCK"
              | "SPLIT"
              | "COMPLETED";
              title: string;
          },
          Error,
      >

      Patches an issue's fields. Implementations must write atomically. The id field cannot be patched — it is excluded from fields.

      Parameters

      • id: string

        Issue to update.

      • fields: Partial<Omit<Issue, "id">>

        Subset of Issue fields to overwrite; id is excluded.

      Returns ResultAsync<
          {
              body: string;
              children: string[];
              id: string;
              parent: string;
              split_count: number;
              state: "NEW"
              | "PLANNED"
              | "IN_PROGRESS"
              | "STUCK"
              | "SPLIT"
              | "COMPLETED";
              title: string;
          },
          Error,
      >

      ok(Issue) with the full updated issue, err(Error) on I/O or API failure.

      Example

      const result = await provider.writeIssue('001', { title: 'Updated title' });
      if (result.isErr()) logger.error({ err: result.error }, 'write failed');

      Overrides IssueProvider.writeIssue

      • Defined in src/core/issue/providers/github.ts:155
